subject: Sexual Health
title: Early Embryo Development
description: A micro-lesson that makes Early Embryo Development usable.

hook.text: In the first eight weeks after implantation, a single cell transforms into a recognizable human form.

buildup.text: Cells divide and specialize rapidly. The heart begins beating by week five, often before mom knows.

discovery.text: Three cell layers form: ectoderm becomes skin and nerves, mesoderm becomes muscles and bones.

twist.text: By week eight, all major organ systems have started forming, yet the embryo is only one inch long.

climax.text: The speed and precision of early development is one of the most remarkable feats in all of biology.

punchline.text: Eight weeks: from one cell to every organ system.

quiz.question: When does the embryonic heart start beating?
